overview:
Konstantin is a social architect with a passion for exploring the intersection of psychology, sociology and computing. He enjoys mentoring the next generation of entrepreneurs, serving on boards and teaching.

Konstantin is a venture partner who enjoys helping entrepreneurs.

Most of his industry experience is in consumer Internet-based communication services and social networking, but his background also includes freemium services, SaaS and immersive media. His interests include marketplaces, crowdsourcing, the Internet of Things and productivity apps/services enabled by the LinkedIn API.

Konstantin’s technical concentrations at Stanford were in artificial intelligence and reasoning under uncertainty. As a son of high school teachers, He grew up in a small town in northern Germany. He has studied, lived and worked in Japan and traveled extensively in South-East Asia.

His proudest professional accomplishment so far is co-founding LinkedIn.
